comment:
Latest Rider - 2025.3.0.1, latest plugin - 1.5.61-243. 2 exceptions on IDE start and frozen chat window. Does anyone test this plugin?

UPD: Looks like, you guys cannot say what your plugin depends on and just throw exception, right? I'll help you: git (which JetBrains are in progress of killing - IJPL-177161) and Terminal (which is awful IMHO). Please, check your dependencies and a) don't depend on what is not absolutely necessary and b) if some dependency is not enabled, only the part of your plugin that ultimately depends on it should gracefully stop working. It's more like work of 2-nd grade students, not a big company.

plugin.name: GitHub Copilot - Your AI Pair Programmer

comment: just garbage, do not install it, it killed my PHPStorm, making it completely unusable, needed to remove everything related to this plugin manually through the console, Do yourself a favor and do not install this shit

plugin.name: GitHub Copilot - Your AI Pair Programmer

comment: I switched to VSCode because IntelliJ lacked user-friendly AI plugins. The available plugins in IntelliJ were unstable—they often crashed or stopped working. Fortunately, I haven’t encountered these issues in VSCode.

plugin.name: GitHub Copilot - Your AI Pair Programmer

comment: IntelliJ Idea unrecoverably hangs every couple of hours due to this plugin. I had to kill the whole process tree several times, in all cases I lost some part of source code. As of now, plugin disabled and I started to look for alternatives.

plugin.name: GitHub Copilot - Your AI Pair Programmer

comment: Right after I started paying for this, the plugin stopped working completely. I've already reinstalled the plugin, logged out and logged back in, updated the IDE, invalidated caches, and restarted the IDE several times. It's still stuck on Initialization and I cannot access any functionality.

plugin.name: GitHub Copilot - Your AI Pair Programmer

comment:
The agent mode does not work really at all. It won't edit my files. Junie is 100x better even though it is far slower and burns up credits like no tomorrow.

Makes me wonder if there's some sort of deal to intentionally make GitHub Copilot terrible so that we purchase more Junie credits? Hmmmmm.....

plugin.name: GitHub Copilot - Your AI Pair Programmer

comment: It's great that I have a plugin for Copilot for Rider, but unfortunately, the plugin for Rider seems to receive little attention from the GitHub Dev Team. Agent mode crashes frequently, leaving files in a state where they cannot be compiled. Others have already pointed out that the user interface for adding files is buggy and always tries to add the currently selected file. Most of the features that are available for the Visual Studio plugin are missing... I pay for Copilot and feel like a second-class citizen.

plugin.name: GitHub Copilot - Your AI Pair Programmer

comment: Sadly this is very bad comparing with VSCode. MCP just don't work, there is no way to use one. Not only because configuration file doesn't have an UI, that's even acceptable, but even if you crack the right configuration, and have a MCP server ready to be called, it's just ignored. I understand that they have their own solution, but nowadays using copilot is very often non negotiable. I hope they fix it sooner rather than later

plugin.name: GitHub Copilot - Your AI Pair Programmer

comment: Idem, I not even can change files in agent mode.

plugin.name: GitHub Copilot - Your AI Pair Programmer

comment: I not even can change files in agent mode, it just produces errors and burns through tokens, something of the worst piece of software I ever used. Thanks to my company which forces me to use that one....

plugin.name: GitHub Copilot - Your AI Pair Programmer

comment: do not accept instructions or randomly ignores them, ignores terminal output, and running locally usually does not work (terminal hungs) UI does not allow to reference to MCP e.g. to terminal output like in VSC, MCP are not working, and hard to guess why, authorization on some addresses much different domain than while replying (our IT had problem to recognize which to allow to be able to authorize)

plugin.name: GitHub Copilot - Your AI Pair Programmer

plugin.name: GitHub Copilot - Your AI Pair Programmer

comment: Overall usability is trash. Compared to vscode where the experience is very smooth. I am stucked with the "Retrieving GitHub Device Code" just like everyone else. It seems JetBrains did it on purpose just to promote the usage of their native AI built in plugin, which I'll unfortunately try to use.

plugin.name: GitHub Copilot - Your AI Pair Programmer

comment: was this written using GitHub Copilot?

plugin.name: GitHub Copilot - Your AI Pair Programmer

comment: It's impossible to configure an MCP, the screen keeps loading indefinitely. Documentation on guidelines is poor.

plugin.name: GitHub Copilot - Your AI Pair Programmer

comment: Really oweful! What a shit to use in PyCharm compared with smoothed completion and context understanding in VS Code!

plugin.name: GitHub Copilot - Your AI Pair Programmer

comment:
It just sucks that you basically have no control over the plugin, and the performance is so noticeable. It just keeps showing unneeded features in your face that you have to jump through hoops to disable. For example, if you highlight some code, it will always show you a gutter icon for Copilot options, and you can't even disable it or even the "Code review" feature.

Completions work great, but the chat and the plugin customization are bad, not to mention that the copy/paste functions don't even work properly on macOS.

plugin.name: GitHub Copilot - Your AI Pair Programmer

comment: Borderline unusable. It cannot read any terminal output of PyCharm, cannot interact with any registered MCP tools (as opposed to: MCP servers) and basically resends all terminal commands until the original command finally finishes, burning up all my API credits. Horrible quality.

plugin.name: GitHub Copilot - Your AI Pair Programmer

comment: It's pretty obvious Jetbrains made some sort of deal with Github on this. Compared to copilot in vscode this plugin is absolute trash... It has no ability to bring the entire codebase in scope and it will not read files that are read only (no perforce integration)... The AI assistant is better, but that tool is nowhere near as good as copilot when its made well. Fix it please!

plugin.name: GitHub Copilot - Your AI Pair Programmer

comment: Worked ok for one day, now, no matter what mode I have selected, it acts as if it's in chat mode, not agent mode. Even after restarting the editor..

plugin.name: GitHub Copilot - Your AI Pair Programmer

comment: Works but has many UX bugs, some editors switch to presentation mode when the agent updated a file so the user can't see the actual file change

plugin.name: GitHub Copilot - Your AI Pair Programmer

comment: Buggiest plugin in JetBrains ecosystem, and thats something. Autocomplete is completely broken, but even without it it produces soo many errors.

plugin.name: GitHub Copilot - Your AI Pair Programmer

comment: Since they have their own AI solution—which is significantly more expensive—the Copilot integration in JetBrains’ IDEs has been problematic. I have to downgrade every time just to use it.

plugin.name: GitHub Copilot - Your AI Pair Programmer

comment: switched mode on agent but runs and processing prompt in ask mode

plugin.name: GitHub Copilot - Your AI Pair Programmer

comment: Latest nightly update broke agent mode, so whatever you want to do runs in ask/chat mode.

plugin.name: GitHub Copilot - Your AI Pair Programmer

comment: It is constantly broken. It has been weeks since integration is broken, on each updates, I still need to revert to an old version to get it to start.

plugin.name: GitHub Copilot - Your AI Pair Programmer

comment:
I hate vs code and love Jetbrains IDEs, with Classic UI of course :)

But this plugin works very good in vscode, as other people noted.

Here, in Jetrains IDEs it is a kind of joke. It makes more mistakes than VSCode, and if you try to revert changes, it can mess up your codebase and break files.

I hate UI in vscode, I lose productivity there, but have to use both IDEs, vscode for running large GPT tasks.

plugin.name: GitHub Copilot - Your AI Pair Programmer

comment:
There are some issues:

  1. does not recognize several modules in multi module maven project as a workspace, as a result cannot find required files and works only with one module (e.g. in my case it's a data migration sources). There is no settings to configure it.
  2. Multiple crashes during the day.
  3. In a light theme selecting the text in copilot window is not highlighted. Also it's not possible to set a default model. It always resets to different one when creating a new chat.

plugin.name: GitHub Copilot - Your AI Pair Programmer

comment:
Currently it just fails: "Error: Failed to load jobs: Unexpected error when search coding agent jobs"

Before, it just couldn't edit any files, the agent went back and forth until it decided to dump the changed source code. You should just use VS Code

plugin.name: GitHub Copilot - Your AI Pair Programmer

comment: azmcp process is killing my IDE and whole MacOS on M1. This is the first thing after 5 years which starts my fans in my macbook! The worst part is it starts happening randomly, even while I'm not using Intellij and the IDE is only minimised. It's not IDE related problem, I have identical experience on VS Code

plugin.name: GitHub Copilot - Your AI Pair Programmer

comment: There are bugs everywhere especially with code completion, where a weird, inexplicable window pops up and can’t even be automatically closed or hidden. I’m starting to wonder if it’s actually been tested at all!

plugin.name: GitHub Copilot - Your AI Pair Programmer

comment: Poor integration, compared to what's available to VS code users.

plugin.name: GitHub Copilot - Your AI Pair Programmer

comment: Unable to log into Copilot plugin when using IntelliJ build 243 or newer (like build 252). I had to downgrade Copilot to version 1.5.52-243 and IntelliJ to build 243 (from 252) to make Copliot work with IntelliJ. The newer versions (1.5.58-243 and 1.5.59-243) of Copilot does not mention login in release notes, so I can't upgrade neither Copilot nor IntelliJ. Also integration with IntelliJ should be better but this may be better in the versions of the plugin I am unable to use.

Unable to login in....

plugin.name: GitHub Copilot - Your AI Pair Programmer

comment: Common, fix the issues. Agent mode fails to run commands in terminal. Sometimes it even corrupts files! How can you deploy software without testing it?

plugin.name: GitHub Copilot - Your AI Pair Programmer

comment: Integration is horrible, keeps failing on the simplest requests. VS code for the same prompt generate answer/edit etc. This plugin keeps failing.

plugin.name: GitHub Copilot - Your AI Pair Programmer

comment: Almost good, at least by day to day basis with suggestions/auto-completion and primitive functionality is done right. Chat needs to be improve

plugin.name: GitHub Copilot - Your AI Pair Programmer

comment: Impressive how horrible this is for a paid product

plugin.name: GitHub Copilot - Your AI Pair Programmer

comment: Every release seems to break core functionality. This time, after pressing any character, the chat or agent editor loses focus, forcing you to click again with the mouse before typing the next character. If this plugin received even 5% of the time and attention given to the VSCode plugin, it would be legendary in the JetBrains ecosystem. It feels like the GitHub team intentionally frustrates developers to push them from JetBrains to VSCode. It’s disappointing that the JetBrains team has also failed to keep up with AI integration in their plugin.

plugin.name: GitHub Copilot - Your AI Pair Programmer
